They spent too much on their military, and neglected to keep their antiquated infrastructures up to date. They were overstaffed, but at least people had jobs.

Chernobyl did deal a swift death blow to them though, financially.

Now we just got to wait till North Korea capitulates.

topics.author: 5043cdb47f123b72cc0032d3

topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54a99b3d636872368aff0000#post_54a99b3d636872368aff0000
Well we're getting synthesized food in a couple years so that's close enough.
If space mining takes off a fair number of people will be living in space in our lifetime; granted it's not going to be no 8 billion people or such, but still a million is still a drastic number.
Theoretically speaking we should find evidence of alien life in the next twenty years because NASA is working on drawing up plans on a Europa probe; the SETI program potentially has a exponential amount of searching, because the problem isn't that we don't have enough dishes looking but rather we don't have enough resources currently to scour through all the frequencies of all of time and space at all times currently(personally I have high hopes in the long run for this because the problem is a logistics problem of trying to look through large amounts of data in short amounts of time).
People that say we're going to be teleporting don't know what the hell they're talking about; the energy for teleporting a single human through say a wormhole exceeds the total energy of the universe.  I doubt any time soon we'll have more energy than the entire universe under our control.

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54a99d37636872394b040000#post_54a99d37636872394b040000
Remember that movie, Bicentennial Man?
Apparently they had humanoid robot servants for every suburban family by 2005.
Synthesized food might take some time to catch on, especially in cultures [spoiler]like mine[/spoiler] that are rather conservative on the field of gastronomy. But seeing the need to feed the ever growing population, necessity may trump everything else.
They say that by 2010 or so, we'd have intelligent lifeforms living along side us. We humans still have yet to learn to live peacefully with each other, let alone coexisting with alien life.
